title: I honest to God hate everything about Lux
body: Say what you will about Zoe or Neeko but they actually have to put themselves in harm's way to maximize their damage potential. Rather than snipe you from 2 1/2 screens away or get a simple snare off and then blast you into next year.

One of my favorite things to do against Lux as Galio.

1: Pretend to be scared of her poke until she feels comfortable trying to go me for free

2: pretend like I’m going for a CS (preferably while her Q’s on cooldown)

3: watch her use E to poke

4: Keep walking forward as the E wizzes by my head and explodes behind me,  as I pop the angry Darius emote.

5: punish/kill.

Step 4 is always hilarious.

Gonna have to disagree with you on this one. Aside from her ult having a crappy hitbox especially going over top river (doesn't hit where laser is, hits where it isn't) lux is a pretty fair and balanced champion and I'd much prefer fighting her than almost anyone else bc she's less obnoxious and broken. She has no escape, she's squishy, she does no damage when behind, if she misses q she just instantly dies against anyone with a brain. If average with the game she is required to walk up to auto range to proc her passive bc  that is 1/3 to 1/2 of her damage. Yes, she is tough to play against if you feed her, and she doesn't need her passive dmg anymore bc she's supposed to be a hypercarry that's pretty simple to not feed. Try playing zed, w through her really predictable q every time and crap on her, you're welcome :)

Excluding assassins (and a well played Sion/Olaf), she pretty much invalidates melees when played even semi competently. She's nearly auto-win on ARAM and 3v3, since there's barely any room to dodge her spells. 

Her top tier spot on 3v3 is interesting, because the map is generally overrun by bruisers and melee carries, both of whom should have an easy time dealing with her, according to the boards.

She's at the top of every map's tier list for a reason. I mean, the numbers can't lie. I'm not specifically qq'ing, but I think Lux is a lot stronger than people give credit for.
